title: Strange Days at the U.N. as Russia Takes the Helm of the Security Council
description: The monthlong presidency of an organization dedicated to preserving world peace is now in the hand of a nation waging the biggest land war in Europe in decades.

title: Pro-War Bloggers Like One Killed in Bombing Are an Influential Group
description: The blogger killed in a bombing in St. Petersburg was one of the influential ultranationalists pushing for harsher pursuit of Russia’s war against Ukraine.

title: Russia Accuses Dissidents and Ukraine of Killing Pro-War Blogger
description: The authorities detained a woman they said had delivered the bomb, hidden in a statuette, that killed the blogger, and called it the work of antigovernment activists and Ukraine.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Ukraine Prepares a Counteroffensive
description: Also, Trump returns to New York to surrender and North Koreans remain in “state-sponsored slavery” abroad.

title: Woman Arrested In Russian Blogger’s Death Attended Opposition Rallies
description: Russian investigators arrested Daria Trepova, a 26-year-old native of St. Petersburg, on Monday in connection with the killing of the blogger known as Vladlen Tatarsky

title: Evan Gershkovich, WSJ Reporter Detained in Russia, Appeals His Arrest
description: Mr. Gershkovich was detained last Thursday while on a reporting trip to Yekaterinberg, Russia. His newspaper, The Wall Street Journal, and U.S. officials reject the charges of espionage against him as bogus.

title: Migrants Search for Bodies of Loved Ones After Mexico Fire
description: After a deadly fire in a migrant detention center in Ciudad Juárez, Mexico, some victims’ families and friends are still looking for answers about their loved ones.

title: ‘What Happened to My Brother’: A Desperate Search in Mexico
description: After a deadly fire in a migrant detention center in Ciudad Juárez, Mexico, some victims’ families and friends are still looking for answers about their loved ones.

title: Assassinated Pro-War Blogger Was Part of a Radical Russian Movement
description: The blogger killed in a bombing in St. Petersburg was one of the influential ultranationalists pushing for harsher pursuit of Russia’s war against Ukraine.

title: Two Deadly Marburg Virus Outbreaks in Africa Alarm Global Health Experts
description: The spread of the Ebola-like virus has claimed lives but could be a crucial chance to test a vaccine — if supplies and researchers are mobilized in time.

title: Ex-Leader of Kosovo Pleads Not Guilty to War Crimes Charges
description: Hashim Thaci, the former president and prime minister, went on trial in The Hague on charges related to the country’s bloody fight for independence.

title: North Korean Workers Toil in Russia and China, Despite Sanctions
description: Despite sanctions and the pandemic, laborers from the country remain abroad, earning desperately needed cash for the regime, according to a new report.

title: Voters in Paris Turn Their Backs on Electric Rental Scooters
description: A referendum emphasized how many residents had come to regard the scooters as dangerous nuisances with little environmental benefit. The decision may set a precedent for other cities.

title: Wagner Claims ‘Legal’ Control of Bakhmut, While Ukraine Says It Is Still Fighting
description: Yevgeny V. Prigozhin, the Wagner group founder, said Russian forces had raised their country’s flag in the center of Bakhmut.

title: Andrew Tate Is Released From Jail and Placed Under House Arrest
description: Mr. Tate, the social media influencer, and his brother Tristan had been in custody since December, when they were arrested on allegations of human trafficking, rape and forming an organized criminal group.

title: Russia Detains Suspect in Killing of Pro-War Blogger
description: Russian authorities arrested a suspect in Sunday’s bombing in St. Petersburg, and the Kremlin said that Ukraine might have been involved. Here’s what we’re covering:

title: The Year’s Biggest Election
description: The battle for a state Supreme Court seat in Wisconsin.

title: Russia’s assault in eastern Ukraine appears stalled.
The Yearslong Fight To Get Paul Rusesabagina Out of Rwanda
description: Paul Rusesabagina, depicted in the 2004 film about genocide in his country, was reunited with his family last week. It took years of pressure to get him out of Rwanda, where he was convicted on terrorism charges.

title: Malka Leifer Found Guilty in Student Sexual Abuse Case in Australia
description: The verdict against Malka Leifer, who had led an ultra-Orthodox Jewish girls’ school in Melbourne, stemmed from sexual crimes against three sisters.

title: Speculation flares after an influential Russian military blogger is killed by a bomb in St. Petersburg.
Ukrainian Counteroffensive Poses Big Test for Military
description: With powerful Western weapons, newly formed assault units and even a reconstituted Azov battalion, Ukraine is poised for a critical spring campaign. But overcoming casualties and keeping war-weary troops motivated are challenges.

title: Hoping to Travel Abroad? Don’t Put Off Your Passport Application.
description: Processing times for new and renewed passports have increased again. The updated timeline, 10 to 13 weeks, leaves some would-be travelers feeling desperate.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Donald Trump’s expected surrender at a Manhattan courthouse.
